results.content: The teacher is very practise on the subject and the course is interesting, but he goes too fast, he takes too many things for granted, moreover many times to see better it is necessary to put the video in full screen; finally I had asked a question that he never answered . I'm sorry but I didn't like the course as it is.

I'm sorry but I didn't like the course as it is.

results.content: The subject is great and the instructor is a real expert in the subject, however he sometimes moves very fast. Also the course is missing the full source code of the project

response.content:

Source code is available here: https://github.com/atilafassina/all-about-nextjs
I will add it to the course descriptions as soon as documentation is complete

results.content: Really good course! Well done Atila for sure, nice job, I expect to create some NextJS apps when possible. I am curious about Serverless functions and what they offer. What simple NextJS apps will you recommend me to start developing with SSR or whith SSR/SSG ? (I have already done my website/portfolio using SSG with my own APIRest/Gridsome )

response.content:
Nice, Omar!!!
I'm very glad you liked it!!

I'm now editing the module to cover it and will release it in a few days in this course! You will get a notification! :)

In the meanwhile, I will send you a message with some extra ideas to play with Serverless Functions, SSR/SSG!!
